ExtendedSection.Title: Improve the layout of the form editor

Text.name: Text0
Text.content:
As a next step, we distribute the fields on two tabs with the <tabs> definition. If content types are getting larger, it is useful to arrange the important fields that we would like the user to fill in in any case, on a first tab, and the additional fields of lower importance on a second tab. If content types are getting even more large, tabs can also sort the fields by subject. The tabs configuration of example 4 causes the first three fields to be shown on the first tab, and the last field Categories on the second tab.

Some fields may belong together in terms of subject, such as a start date and an end date, and thus are better arranged horizontally than one under another. In example 4, the Title and the DateTime fields are arranged horizontally by means of the <Display>column</Display> definition. The <Display>singleline</Display> definition for the LinkURI field causes the label to be shown left of the field input instead of above.
